snippet: The president said that despite repeated meetings with President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia, no one should expect Russian forces to start attacking the extremist group’s positions in Syria.
abstract: Pres Obama says that Russians are unlikely to attack Islamic State in Syria because of Russia's ties to Syrian Pres Bashar al-Assad.

byline.original: By GARDINER HARRIS and SOMINI SENGUPTA
byline.contributor: Gardiner Harris reported from Le Bourget, and Somini Sengupta from the United Nations. Coral Davenport contributed reporting from Le Bourget.

lead_paragraph: The president said that despite repeated meetings with President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia, no one should expect Russian forces to start attacking the extremist group’s positions in Syria.

headline.main: Russians Unlikely to Attack ISIS in Syria, Obama Says
headline.print_headline: Russians Unlikely to Attack ISIS in Syria, Obama Says

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
